channel.title: Test on BlackHoods Site
channel.description: Recent content in Test on BlackHoods Site

item.title: TamuCTF 2017 - Pwn 4
item.description: Is curious that this specific challenge is more worthy than the previous one (pwn3). As we will see it is way easier. Lets take a look to the code with r2 $ r2 pwn4 -c 'aaa; afl' We can see four interesting functions: sym.flag_func() at 0x080484cb sym.func2() at 0x080484e4 sym.func1() at 0x080484fd sym.main() at 0x08048515 [0x080483d0]> s sym.flag_func; V; p; p # be positioned at start of sym.

item.title: TamuCTF 2017 - Pwn 3
item.description: Here we are, with another pwning challenge. Let’s start üòÅ. $ wget https://ctf.tamu.edu/files/e02cea87728137d5da449db45dcb875e/pwn3 $ r2 pwn3 [0x080484b0]> aaa [0x080484b0]> afl . . 0x080485ab 4 103 sym.print_flag 0x08048612 1 102 sym.main . . Two interesting functions, and again, one of them is never called. [0x080484b0]> axt sym.print_flag # Search for cross references to this function in the entire binary [0x080484b0]> Lets check what is happing inside the main one.
